item.title: Tree Blocking Detection Equipment, 13th July
item.description:

item.title: Towpath near Gloucester Ave, 12th July
item.description:
There’s a large section of damaged and uneven paving along the canal towpath that poses a significant tripping hazard to pedestrians and cyclists. The location is near the Gloucester Ave entrance (what3words: ///shock.chops.onions) Several paving stones are loose, sunken, or missing altogether, creating an unsafe and unstable walking surface. The path is heavily used by pedestrians, joggers, and cyclists, with the canal directly beside it leaving little room to avoid the damaged area safely. Please can you help arrange for the area to be repaired as soon as possible.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Waterside Place, Chalk Farm, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The verge is full of littered plastics, 12th July
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Jamaica Road, Bermondsey, London

item.title: Human Excrement x2, 12th July
item.description:
Hi, local homeless man keeps leaving human excrement down the alley and today two areas half way down on right side if walking to Bellegrove Road is where he has left x2 human excrements. Thanks
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bellegrove Road, Falconwood, London

item.title: Night time bbq in garden, 12th July
item.description:
No regard for neighbours, bbq smoke in our windows after 22.40pm. residential area with lots of flats overlooking the street. All our windows open to get air. Just not respectful. this street does not care about neighbours. Noise from others earlier
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Adley Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped mattress, shopping trolley and fly tipping down Wellington Gardens, 12th July
item.description:
Hi, I reported a dumped mattress and fly tipping opposite 68/70 Wellington Gardens about a week or so ago to yourselves. Unfortunately the mattress and mess still remains in situ. Please can you arrange to have this cleared asap. The dumped mattress and rubbish is either side of Wellington Mews. It is all very much an eyesore and we seemed to be plagued with bluebottles and I’m sure this sort of fly tipping close to my house does not help. I have attached a picture for your information. Look forward to your prompt action to this request. Many thanks, Ross

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wellington Gardens, Charlton, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Why is the play area been emptied but not replaced? Has led to an increase in antisocial behaviour, 12th July
item.description:
The play area was emptied long ago (slide structure removed) but nothing for children has been put back in. This is leading to loitering and antisocial behaviour in the form of grown men and teenagers loitering in the play area, blasting music and smoking
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Freshfield Avenue, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Light disturbance, 12th July
item.description:
This light shines into my property and directly in to the two bedrooms. It is very very bright and disturbs our sleep. Can this be amended as I’ve even purchased black out blinds to try and diffuse how bright it is.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Fern Close, Slade Green, London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Light in park or open space
